Felix Lucka

welcome to my academic web site

Deep Learning for Cone Beam CT Imaging

23 Jun 2021

Over the last years, I’ve been involved in a project to improve various aspects cone-beam CT imaging using deep learning. Recently, two more papers from this work were published. One in Physics in Medicine & Biology proposes an efficient dimension reduction workflow to reduce high cone angle artifacts while one in Computer Methods and Programs in Biomedicine compares different neural network training strategies for image segmentation. Thanks to everyone involved, in particular to Jordi Minnema!

X-ray Light-Field Tomography

22 Dec 2020

My colleague Nicola Viganò (now at ESRF) works on exciting new imaging techniques and recently got me involved in a project on developing X-ray plenoptic cameras (light-field imaging). Check out the corresponding paper, which got published recently. Big thanks to Nicola and everyone involved!

Deep Learning for Reflection-Mode Ultrasound Imaging

15 Sep 2020

About a year ago we started an exciting project on using deep learning to improve various aspects of reflection-mode ultrasound imaging. I did not know much about this imaging modality up to this point and I’m happy to know a little bit more now. Georgios Pilikos just presented our current results (virtually) at the 2020 IEEE Symposium (IUS) Ultrasonics. Check out the conference papers on an end-to-end deep delay-and-sum (DSA) imaging approach and an end-to-end deep US data compression. Thanks to everyone involved, in particular to Georgios.

Atomic Super-Resolution Tomography

21 Jul 2020

I had the pleasure to be involved in a project of Poulami Somanya Ganguly where we tried to reconstruct a nanocrystal at atomic resolution from electron microscopy images using a grid-free super resolution approach. Check out the paper!

Minisymposium at ICIAM 2019

06 Aug 2019

The International Congress on Industrial and Applied Mathematics (ICIAM) will take place in the beautiful town of Valencia, Spain in mid July. It’s gonna be a big, exciting meeting with thousands of participants. Check out the program. Joana Grah, Martin Benning and I are organizing a symposium on “Deep Learning and Inverse Problems”.
